titleInfo.title: (PS) Dev v. Donahoe
titleInfo.subTitle: RELATED CASE ORDER signed by Judge John A. Mendez on 9/18/2013 ORDERING that cases 2:12-CV-03026 TLN-EFB-PS and 2:11-CV-02950 JAM-EFB-PS are RELATED. The action denominated 2:12-CV-03026 TLN-EFB-PS is REASSIGNED to Judge John A. Mendez for all further proceedings, and any dates currently set in this reassigned case only are hereby VACATED. Henceforth, the caption on documents filed in the reassigned cases shall be shown as 2:12-CV-03026 JAM-EFB-PS.(Zignago, K.)

titleInfo.title: (PS) Dev v. Donahoe
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER to SHOW CAUSE signed by Magistrate Judge Edmund F. Brennan on 1/6/2014 ORDERING hearing on defendant's 27 Motion for Summary Judgment is CONTINUED to 2/5/2014; plaintiff shall SHOW CAUSE, in writing, no later than 1/22/2014, why sanctions should not be imposed for failure to timely file an opposition or a statement of non-opposition to the pending motion; plaintiff shall file an opposition to the motion, or a statement of non-opposition thereto, no later than 1/22/2014; failure of plaintiff to file an opposition to the motion will be deemed a statement of non-opposition thereto, and may result in a recommendation that this action be dismissed for lack of prosecution and/or failure to comply with court orders and this court's Local Rules; defendant may file a reply to plaintiff's opposition, if any, on or before 1/29/2014. (Waggoner, D)

extension.courtName: United States District Court Eastern District of California
extension.docketText: ORDER to SHOW CAUSE signed by Magistrate Judge Edmund F. Brennan on 1/6/2014 ORDERING hearing on defendant's 27 Motion for Summary Judgment is CONTINUED to 2/5/2014; plaintiff shall SHOW CAUSE, in writing, no later than 1/22/2014, why sanctions should not be imposed for failure to timely file an opposition or a statement of non-opposition to the pending motion; plaintiff shall file an opposition to the motion, or a statement of non-opposition thereto, no later than 1/22/2014; failure of plaintiff to file an opposition to the motion will be deemed a statement of non-opposition thereto, and may result in a recommendation that this action be dismissed for lack of prosecution and/or failure to comply with court orders and this court's Local Rules; defendant may file a reply to plaintiff's opposition, if any, on or before 1/29/2014. (Waggoner, D)

titleInfo.title: (PS) Dev v. Donahoe
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER and FINDINGS and RECOMMENDATIONS signed by Magistrate Judge Edmund F. Brennan on 4/22/2014 ORDERING hearing re: 45 MOTION to AMEND by Lal Dev is VACATED; RECOMMENDING that Motion to Amend be denied. Matter referred to Judge John A. Mendez. Within 14 days after being served with these findings and recommendations, any party may file written objections. Failure to file objections within the specified time may waive the right to appeal the District Court's order. (Waggoner, D)

titleInfo.title: (PS) Dev v. Donahoe
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER and FINDINGS and RECOMMENDATIONS signed by Magistrate Judge Edmund F. Brennan on 9/25/2014 DENYING plaintiff's motion to strike the declaration of Sandra Schmidt. The Clerk is ORDERED to file the 9/6/2013 deposition of plaintiff in this case. It is hereby RECOMMENDED that the 27 Motion for Summary Judgment be granted, judgment be entered in defendant's favor and the clerk be directed to close the case. Objections due within 14 days after being served with these findings and recommendations. Referred to Judge John A. Mendez. (Donati, J)

extension.courtName: United States District Court Eastern District of California
extension.docketText: ORDER and FINDINGS and RECOMMENDATIONS signed by Magistrate Judge Edmund F. Brennan on 9/25/2014 DENYING plaintiff's motion to strike the declaration of Sandra Schmidt. The Clerk is ORDERED to file the 9/6/2013 deposition of plaintiff in this case. It is hereby RECOMMENDED that the 27 Motion for Summary Judgment be granted, judgment be entered in defendant's favor and the clerk be directed to close the case. Objections due within 14 days after being served with these findings and recommendations. Referred to Judge John A. Mendez. (Donati, J)
